name: Coconut Chicken Curry
history: Coconut Chicken Curry is a popular dish in coastal regions of India, where coconut is abundant. This dish combines the rich flavors of coconut with traditional Indian spices, creating a creamy and aromatic curry.
description: Coconut Chicken Curry is a flavorful Indian dish made with tender chicken pieces cooked in a creamy coconut milk-based sauce. The curry is infused with spices like turmeric, cumin, and coriander, offering a perfect blend of richness and warmth.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add onions and ginger-garlic paste, cooking until onions are golden. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, and garam masala.

instructions.title: Cook the Chicken
instructions.description: Add chicken pieces to the pan. Cook until they start to brown.

instructions.title: Add Tomatoes and Coconut Milk
instructions.description: Stir in chopped tomatoes. Cook until soft. Add coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Cook until the chicken is tender.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like roti or naan.

tips: Use full-fat coconut milk for a richer flavor and creamier texture.
Adjust the amount of red chili powder to control the spice level.
variations: Add vegetables like bell peppers or peas for extra nutrition and color.
For a Thai twist, add lime juice and basil leaves towards the end of cooking.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl, garnished with a sprig of cilantro.
Pair with a side of cucumber salad or a tangy chutney.
